description:
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes, from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver 100+ operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across 70+ countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.

The Google People Services, Extended Workforce Solutions (xWS) team manages end-to-end oversight of Google’s Extended (Contingent) Workforce. The xWS team is responsible for the strategy, governance, and operations across the Temp, Vendor and Contractor (TVC) space. Our team makes it easy for Google managers to engage with the contingent workforce, providing training, standards and guidelines to minimize Google’s risk and offering data and insights on planning and strategy for new and existing engagements. We provide processes, tools and know-how to support Googlers through the lifecycle of contingent workforce engagements, so our businesses can make informed decisions to put the right talent in the right locations.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants, and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them". We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience leading and managing a team.
  • 5 years of experience in strategy or management consulting role.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in outsourcing/offshoring, vendor management, vendor transitions, new site launches, Statement of Work (SOW) development, contracting and/or changing pricing models.
  • Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills with a data-driven approach to problem solving.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills with an ability to influence without authority.
  • Demonstrated personal accountability and integrity with an ability to build and grow relationships across the industry.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills and excellent leadership, organizational and management skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage Google’s contingent workforce strategy and execution in the Americas, including temporary workers, independent contractors, outsourcing, third-party service delivery and other forms of non-permanent labor.
  • Lead a team of business partners distributed across the Americas.
  • Consult with executives within business units using contingent workforce and advise on global workforce strategy, budgeting, partner selection and location.
  • Partner with the regional leadership, diverse stakeholders, business units, Google support teams and Google’s third party partners.
  • Identify areas of risk and partner with Programs and Policy team to drive solutions to mitigate such risks. Partner with Real Estate, Security, Corporate Engineering and other Google teams to ensure a robust and secure infrastructure of facilities and tools to support outsourced operations.
title: Head of Americas, Extended Workforce Solutions
